intro: Tovomita paniculata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Tovomita paniculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its bright, long-lasting blooms.
